humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the largest tumor in the left breast measures 1.9 cm in largest dimension (invasive ductal carcinoma, histologic grade II-III/III, nuclear grade III/III). This falls within the size range for a T1 tumor (2 cm or less). The presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or the percentage of the tumor occupied by in situ component does not affect the T stage for invasive ductal carcinoma. Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of a cancer is determined by the size of the primary tumor. In this report, the left breast shows a firm to hard, fairly circumscribed, centrally placed mass, measuring 1.7 x 1.5 x 1.5 cm, approximately 1.0 cm from the deep margin. Therefore, the T stage for this cancer is T2 (tumor size > 2 cm and ≤ 5 cm).
